org.wtc.eclipse.platform.util
Class StringUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.wtc.eclipse.platform.util.StringUtil

public class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains utility methods for dealing with Strings.

escapeJava

public static java.lang.String escapeJava(java.lang.String s)
Turn a string into something that can be used as a string constant in a java source file. This includes adding quotes, and escaping special characters like quotes, backslashes, and newlines.

indexOfIgnoreCase

public static int indexOfIgnoreCase(java.lang.String source,
                                    java.lang.String pattern)
Return the index of pattern in source, ignoring case. 
 Example: Util.indexOfIgnoreCase(" blee Blee BlEe", "BlEe") => 1

Parameters:
source - a string
pattern - the pattern string to look for.

indexOfIgnoreCase

public static int indexOfIgnoreCase(java.lang.String source,
                                    java.lang.String pattern,
                                    int start)
Return the index of pattern in source, ignoring case. 
 Example: Util.indexOfIgnoreCase(" blee Blee BlEe", "BlEe", 4) => 6

Parameters:
source - a string
pattern - the pattern string to look for.
start - where to start searching from

onlyDiffersByExtension

public static boolean onlyDiffersByExtension(java.lang.String path1,
                                             java.lang.String path2)
Determine if two paths are the same, disregarding the file extension. i.e. onlyDiffersByExtension("foo.jsp", "foo.html") returns true; but onlyDiffersByExtension("foo.jsp", "bar.jsp") returns false. If either path does not have a file extension, the path is compared as-is, so onlyDiffersByExtension( "foo.jsp", "foo" ) will return true.

Parameters:
path1 - A path to compare
path2 - Another path to compare
Returns:
true if they are the same except for the file extension.

replaceAll

public static java.lang.String replaceAll(java.lang.String str,
                                          java.lang.String strPattern,
                                          java.lang.String strReplace)
Replaces all of the occurrences of strPattern with strReplace. Note that unlike String.replace, strPattern and strReplace are _not_ regular expressions

split

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> split(java.lang.String str,
                                                     char delim)
Returns a list containing the parts of the string that are separated by the given delimiter.

                                                     char delim,
                                                     boolean fTrim,
                                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> parts)
Returns a list containing the parts of the string that are separated by the given delimiter. fTrim will skip empty values

truncateString

public static java.lang.String truncateString(java.lang.String input,
                                              int width,
                                              java.awt.FontMetrics fm)
gets a shorter version of the given string, no wider than width when rendered in fm metrics. this will return null only if the original input is null.

validateJavaIdentifier

public static boolean validateJavaIdentifier(java.lang.String id,
                                             java.lang.StringBuffer message)
Return whether or not a string is a valid java identifier with an info message.

Parameters:
id -
message -
Returns:
whether the passed in string is a valid java identifier

wrapText

public static java.lang.String wrapText(java.lang.String s,
                                        int desiredLength,
                                        int maxLength)
Wraps the given text in HTML, attempting to be between the desired and maximum length on each line. If there aren't any breaks between those two points, it will use the first break before the desired length. If there are no breaks, it will wrap the line at the maximum length. Also escapes HTML values.
